alert.note: Alert for Lake (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following area, Lake IN. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a line of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall extending from eastern Cook County through northeastern Will County. These storms have a history of producing rain rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour, with observed rain amounts exceeding 1.5 inches in Cook County. Minor flooding of roadways and underpasses may begin quickly after thunderstorms arrive. - Rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible with these storms. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Hammond, East Chicago, Whiting, Gary, Munster, Griffith, Schererville, Merrillville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
